author: Chris Zadorozny chris.zadorozny@sentinel-standard.com
title: Raiders finish 11th in Division 4 finals
text: Raiders finish 11th in Division 4 finals The 2015 Division 4 MHSAA Boy’s State Tennis Finals occurred over the weekend. A two-day event, Portland was left to participate in just one day. Comment Posted Oct. 19, 2015 at 10:46 PM By Chris Zadorozny Posted Oct. 19, 2015 at 10:46 PM KALAMAZOO - The 2015 Division 4 MHSAA Boy’s State Tennis Finals occurred over the weekend. A two-day event, Portland was left to participate in just one day. After rain forced matches indoors for the day, the Raiders ended up finishing in a tie for 11th place with Grand Rapids West Catholic, Jackson Lumen Christi and Paw Paw for 7 points each. Ann Arbor Greenhills won the state title with 37 points. Williamston, who also came out of Portland’s regional finished tied for 7th with 10 points. Number four singles, Chris Platte went the longest for the singles flights, getting a bye in his first match, winning his second match and losing the third match. Platte defeated Charlie Trapper of Paw Paw in three sets, 2-6, 6-2 and 6-3. In the next round, he lost to Trent Meeker, the number five seed from Ludington in two sets, 6-1, 6-1. In the doubles flights, the number one singles team of Cole Schneider and Trevor Trierweiler won their first two matches before falling in the third match, the longest of the Raiders doubles flights. They defeated Ben Beekman and Sean Kosnik of West Catholic in two sets, 7-6(3), 6-3 in the first match of the day. They then defeated Tyler Yezman and Kevin Kuhn of Grosse Ile in three sets, 6-4, 3-6 and 6-3. In their third match, they lost to number one seed, Eric Butzer and Alec Milliron of Whitehall, 6-1, 2-6, 6-4. “The guys had several matches in which they improved on scores from earlier in the season,” said Portland head coach Jim Niebling. In the number one singles flight, senior Bailey VanHouten lost to number four seed TJ Dulac of Grosse Pointe Woods University Liggett in two straight sets, 6-0, 6-0. In the number two singles flight, Jared Schrauben lost in two straight sets, 6-1, 6-1 to Tommy Clare of Kalamazoo Hackett. In the number three singles flight, Connor Davis lost to Conor Briegel of Whitehall in two straight sets, 6-4, 6-2. In the number two doubles flight, Ryan Elliott and Blake Guy won their first patch over Ben Cooper and Bryce Chesney of Jackson Lumen Christi in two sets, 6-3, 6-1. In their second match, they lost in two straight sets, 6-2, 6-1 to number two seed, Will Gersch and Dave Sekhon of Grosse Pointe Woods University Liggett. In the number three doubles flight, Sam Linebaugh and Jack Lufkin won their first set, 7-5, 6-1 over Jack Zwemer and Andrew Tallquist of Whitehall. In their second match, they lost to eventual state champions and number one seed Casey Scoggin and Alec Azar of Grosse Pointe Woods University Liggett, 6-0, 6-3. In the number four doubles flight, Ryan Lefke and Jarrett Hoppes won their first match, 6-4, 6-2 over Daniel Huspen and Zach Mngo of Berrien Springs. In their second match, they lost to number six seed, Spencer Trnka and Ben Stenglein of Whitehall in two sets, 6-4, 6-4. Page 2 of 2 - “We are all very proud of what these guys have accomplished,” said Niebling. The 11th place finish is two spots up from their 13th place finish last year and one point better. Follow Sports Editor Chris Zadorozny on Twitter @ZadsISS. By Chris Zadorozny
